fields.label: Attestation
fields.comment: A conformity attestation issued by a competent body that defines one or more assessments (eg carbon intensity) about a product (eg batttery) against a specification (eg LCA method) defined in a standard or regulation.

fields.label: Authorisation
fields.comment: The authority under which a conformity claim is issued.  For example a national accrediation authority may accredit a test lab to issue test certificates about a product against a standard.

fields.label: BinaryFile
fields.comment: A file representing a data snapshot that is used to infomr the conformity assessment.

fields.label: Characteristic
fields.comment: Product specific characteristics.  This class is an extension point for industry specific product characteristics or performance information such as clothing size or battery capacity.

fields.label: Circularity
fields.comment: High level corcularity information about this product.  Note that this doens not substitute for detailed product circularity data sheet (PCDS) criteria which would be represented as a set of conformity claims against individual ISO PCDS criteria.

fields.label: Classification
fields.comment: A classification scheme and code / name representing a category value for a product, entity, or facility.

fields.label: Coordinate
fields.comment: A map coordinate defined by a lattitude & longditude pair.

fields.label: Criteria
fields.comment: A specific rule or criterion within a standard or regulation. eg a carbon intensity calculation rule within an emissions standard.

fields.label: Declaration
fields.comment: A specific assessment about the product or facility against a specific specification.  Eg the carbon intensity of a given product or batch.

fields.label: Dimension
fields.comment: Overall (length, width, height) dimensions and weight/volume of an item.

fields.label: Facility
fields.comment: The physical site (eg farm or factory) where the product or materials was produced.

fields.label: Identifier
fields.comment: An identifier of a party, product, or facility that is defined by an identifier scheme and idenfier value.

fields.label: Location
fields.comment: Location information including address and geolocation of points, areas, and boundaries

fields.label: Material
fields.comment: The material class encapsulates details about the origin or source of raw materials in a product, including the country of origin and the mass fraction.

fields.label: Measure
fields.comment: The measure class defines a numeric measured value (eg 10) and a coded unit of measure (eg KG).

fields.label: Metric
fields.comment: A specific measure of performance against the criteria that governs the claim.  Expressed as an array of metric (ie unit of emasure) / value (ie the actual numeric value) pairs.

fields.label: Party
fields.comment: An organisation.  May be a supply chain actor, a certifier, a government agency.

fields.label: Product
fields.comment: The ProductInformation class encapsulates detailed information regarding a specific product, including its identification details, manufacturer, and other pertinent details.

fields.label: Regulation
fields.comment: A regulation (eg EU deforestation regulation) that defines the criteria for assessment.

fields.label: SecureBinaryFile
fields.comment: A binary file that is hashed ()for tamper evidence) and optionally encrypted (for confidentiality).

fields.label: Standard
fields.comment: A standard (eg ISO 14000) that specifies the criteria for conformance.

fields.label: Latitude
fields.comment: The latitude of a map location expressed in decimal degrees (between +90 and -90) where negative values represent latitudes south of the equator.

fields.label: Longditude
fields.comment: The longditude of a map location expressed in decimal degrees (between +180 and -180) where negative values represent longditudes west of the prime meridian.

fields.label: MaterialName
fields.comment: Name of this material (eg "Egyptian Cotton")

fields.label: accreditation
fields.comment: The accreditation from a competent authority (ag NATA) that confirms the issuers authorised scope of assessments.

fields.label: accreditationCertificate
fields.comment: The evidence that supports the authroty under which the attestation is issued - eg an accreditation certificate.

fields.label: accuracy
fields.comment: A percentage represented as a numeric between 0 and 1 indicating the rage of accuracy of the claimed value (eg 0.05 means that the actual value is within 5% of the claimed value.)

fields.label: areaReference
fields.comment: The area of the facility as a URI - typically a plus code (see https://maps.google.com/pluscodes/)

fields.label: assessmentCriterion
fields.comment: The specification against which the assessment is made.

fields.label: assessmentLevel
fields.comment: Assurance pertaining to assessment (any authority or support for the assessment process)

fields.label: assessorLevel
fields.comment: Assurance code pertaining to assessor (relation to the object under assessment)

fields.label: attestationDescription
fields.comment: A textual description of the scope or purpose of this confomrity attestation

fields.label: attestationType
fields.comment: The type of criterion (optional or mandatory).

fields.label: auditableEvidence
fields.comment: Auditable evidence supporting this assessment such as raw measurements, supporting documents. This is usally private data and would normally be encrypted.

fields.label: batchNumber
fields.comment: Information regarding the specific production batch of the product.

fields.label: boundary
fields.comment: The list of coordinates that define a closed area polygon as a location boundary.

fields.label: classificationSchemeID
fields.comment: Classification scheme  - eg https://unstats.un.org/unsd/classifications/Econ/cpc

fields.label: classificationSchemeName
fields.comment: The name of the classificaiotn schema - eg United Nations Central Product Classification

fields.label: classifierName
fields.comment: Name of the classifier - eg "Asparagus" for code "01211" in UNCPC

fields.label: classifierValue
fields.comment: classifier value within the scheme - eg "01211" in UN CPC

fields.label: compliance
fields.comment: An indicator of whether or not the assessment meets the specification.

fields.label: conformityCertificate
fields.comment: A reference to the human / printable version of this conformity attestation - typically represented as a PDF document. The document may have more details than are represented in the digital attestation.

fields.label: conformityTopic
fields.comment: The conformity topic category for this assessment (eg vocabulary.uncefact.org/sustainability/emissions)

fields.label: countryOfOperation
fields.comment: The country in which this facility is operating.

fields.label: countryOfProduction
fields.comment: The country in which this item was produced / manufactured.

fields.label: criteriName
fields.comment: A name that describes this criteria (eg tensile strength)

fields.label: declaredValues
fields.comment: The list of specific values measured as part of this assessment (eg tensile strength)

fields.label: description
fields.comment: A textual description providing details about the product.

fields.label: dimensions
fields.comment: The physical dimensions of the product. Not every dimension is relevant to every products.  For example bulk materials may have wieght and volume but not length, with, or height.

fields.label: effectiveDate
fields.comment: the date at which the regulation came into effect.

fields.label: encryptionMethod
fields.comment: The symmetric encryption algorithm used to encrypt this binary file.  AES is the recommended standard

fields.label: facilityName
fields.comment: The name of the facility, represented as a text string.

fields.label: fileHash
fields.comment: The MD5 hash of the file.

fields.label: fileName
fields.comment: A name for referenced binary file A name for referenced binary file

fields.label: fileType
fields.comment: The type of file, represented as a MIME type. The type of file, represented as a MIME type.

fields.label: furtherInformation
fields.comment: A URL pointing to further human readable information about the product.

fields.label: geoLocation
fields.comment: The latitude and logditude coordinates that best represent the specified location

fields.label: hashMethod
fields.comment: The hashing algorithm used to create the file hash.  SHA-265 is the recommedned standard

fields.label: hazardous
fields.comment: Indicates whether this material is hazardous. If true then the materialSafetyInformation proerty must be present

fields.label: height
fields.comment: The height of the product or packaging

fields.label: id
fields.comment: A globally unique URI for the that identifies this organisation - eg https://abr.business.gov.au/ABN/View?abn=90664869327 The globally unique URI representing the specific classifier value - for example https://vocabulary.uncefact.org/unlocode?country=au#AUSYD is the gloabl URI representing the UN/LOCODE for Sydney Australia. A linked data URL for the entity (product, facility, or organisation) that is identified by this identifier - eg https://abr.business.gov.au/ABN/View?abn=90664869327  The gloablly ubique identifer of this location.  Typically a google pin or a GS1 GLN. Eg https://maps.app.goo.gl/6WuY7AQ8z97HwjDCA The globally unique ID of the product. eg )https://id.gs1.org/01/09520123456788/21/12345 GLobally unique ID for the binary file - usually it's location as a URL. GLobally unique ID for the binary file - usually it's location as a URL. A unique identifier for the standard (eg https://www.iso.org/standard/60857.html). The globally unique ID of the standard - eg https://www.iso.org/standard/60857.html The identifier of the regulation - eg https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A32023R1115)  A unique identifier for the criterion - managed by the standards uthority or regulator. The globally unique ID of this conformity attestation.  The globally unique URI for this authorisation. Use idScheme/idValue if not otherwise defined by the issuing authority

fields.label: idScheme
fields.comment: The scheme ID for the organisation ID, usually the registry operator - eg abr.business.gov.au the identifier scheme as defined by the registrar that manages the identifier registry. Eg abr.busines.gov.au If the identifier scheme is registered with UNTP then this URI can use used to dicsover the resolution method (to get more data) and the verification method (to prove ownership). remove because did already contains a scheme (ie it is a did:web) The scheme of the location identifier. eg maps.app.goo.gl The scheme used for the product identifier.  Eg )https://id.gs1.org/01 A globally unique ID for the authorisation scheme. use issuer authority domainName/schemeName if not otherwise specified.

fields.label: idSchemeName
fields.comment: The name of the business registration scheme - eg Austrlaian Business Number The identifier scheme name (eg Australian Business Number or GS1 Global Trade Item Number)) removed because this is defiend to be a DID the name of the location identifier scheme. Eg Google Pin The scheme name of the product identifier - eg SGTIN The name given to this authoristion scheme.

fields.label: idValue
fields.comment: The value of the organisation identifier within the scheme - eg 90664869327 The value of the identifier within the scheme (eg 90664869327) removed because the id is the did value. The value of the identifier within the scheme - eg 6WuY7AQ8z97HwjDCA The value of the identifier within the scheme - eg )09520123.456788.12345 the authorisation number such as an accreditation number

fields.label: industryCategory
fields.comment: The industry categories for this organisations.  Recommend use of UNCPC as the category scheme.

fields.label: issueDate
fields.comment: The date when the standard was issued.

fields.label: issuedTo
fields.comment: The party to whom the conformity attestation was issued.

fields.label: issuingAuthority
fields.comment: The competent authority that issued the accreditation.

fields.label: issuingBody
fields.comment: The party that issued the standard (ID and Name reference only) the issuing body of the regulation.

fields.label: length
fields.comment: The length of the product or packaging

fields.label: locationInformation
fields.comment: Geolocation and address information for this facility

fields.label: locationName
fields.comment: The name of the location. Eg Australian museum.

fields.label: massFraction
fields.comment: A numeric value representing the mass fraction of the product represented by this material. The sum of all mass fraction values for a given passport should be 100.

fields.label: materialSafetyInformation
fields.comment: Refernece to further information obout safe handling of this hazardous material (for example a link to a material safety data sheet)

fields.label: materialType
fields.comment: The type of this material - as a value drawn from a controlled vocabulary eg textileexchange.org/materials/rm01014 - representing organic cotton.

fields.label: metricName
fields.comment: A human readable name for this metric (for example "Tensile strength")

fields.label: metricValue
fields.comment: A numeric value and unit of measure for this metric. Could be a measured value or a specified threshold.

fields.label: operatedBy
fields.comment: The Party entity responsible for operating the facility.

fields.label: organisationWebsite
fields.comment: Website for this organisation

fields.label: originCountry
fields.comment: A ISO 3166-1 code representing the country of origin of the component or ingredient.

fields.label: otherIdentifiers
fields.comment: An optional lsit of other registered identifiers for this organisations An optional list of other registered identifiers for this facility

fields.label: partyName
fields.comment: The name of the organization or company, represented as a text string.  SHOULD match the registered name in the identifeir scheme. Eg PYX Industries Pty Ltd

fields.label: postalAddress
fields.comment: The textual address of the location.

fields.label: processCategory
fields.comment: The idustrial or production processes performed by this facility.

fields.label: producedAt
fields.comment: The Facility where the product batch was produced / manufactured.

fields.label: producedBy
fields.comment: The Party entity that manufactured the product.

fields.label: productCategory
fields.comment: A code representing the product's class, typically using the UN CPC (United Nations Central Product Classification) https://unstats.un.org/unsd/classifications/Econ/cpc

fields.label: productImage
fields.comment: A unique identifier (URI) pointing to an image of the product.

fields.label: productName
fields.comment: The name of the product - eg ACME Tinned Beans 500g

fields.label: productionDate
fields.comment: The ISO 8601 date on which the product batch was manufactured.

fields.label: recyclableContent
fields.comment: The percentage of the this product (my mass) that has been designed to be recyclable.

fields.label: recycledAmount
fields.comment: Percentage of this material that is recycled (eg 80% recycled Cotton)

fields.label: recyclingInformation
fields.comment: A URI pointing to recycling information for the product.

fields.label: recyecledContent
fields.comment: The percentage (by mass) of recycled content in this product

fields.label: referenceRegulation
fields.comment: The reference to the regulation that defines the assessment criteria

fields.label: referenceStandard
fields.comment: The reference to the standard that defines the specification / criteria

fields.label: registrationCountry
fields.comment: the country in which this organisation is registered

fields.label: regulationName
fields.comment: The name of the regulation - eg EU deforestation regulation.

fields.label: repairInformation
fields.comment: A URI pointing to repair instructions for this product.

fields.label: serialNumber
fields.comment: An array of identifiers representing a specific serialised item of the product.

fields.label: standardName
fields.comment: The name of the standard (eg ISO 14001:2015 Environmental management system)

fields.label: thresholdValues
fields.comment: A conformity threshold defined by the specification (eg minimum compressive strength)

fields.label: trustmark
fields.comment: The trust mark image awarded by the AB to the CAB to indicate accrediation.

fields.label: unit
fields.comment: Unit of measure drawn from the UNECE rec20 measure code list.

fields.label: value
fields.comment: The numeric value of the measure

fields.label: volume
fields.comment: The displacement volume of the product.

fields.label: weight
fields.comment: the weight of the product

fields.label: width
fields.comment: The width of the product or packaging

fields.label: encryptionMethodCode#AES
fields.comment: AES standard

fields.label: encryptionMethodCode#none
fields.comment: no encryption
